metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4881 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
CVE-2023-4881 was wrongly assigned to a bug that was deemed to be anon-security issue by the Linux kernel security team.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4881` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-246-generic - 4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-246-generic - 4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-246-lowlatency - 4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1124-aws - 4.4.0-1124.130
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1171-azure - 4.15.0-1171.186~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1124.130').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1171.186~14.04.1').
